ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Overall it was a great course. It was a little frustrating how limited we were in reviewing the archives of Rachel Carson's papers during our only "field trip."

John and Mary Evelyn might think about working on their balance of material presentation in class. Mary Evelyn is somewhat overbearing and John doesn't get a lot of time to talk, even though his points, when offered, are often more clear than Mary Evelyn's.
Course could have ended a week or two sooner or dove into more material in that final stretch as there was some repetition. Also wanted to hear from John Grim more.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The best aspect of this course is the online discussions, which are very well organized and thoughtful than in class discussions.

Interdisciplinary nature of the students in the class bringing together diverse perspectives and areas of expertise. John and Mary Evelyn are clearly masters of the material and contributed meaningfully to shaping class discussions.

Working on the reading and videos at our own pace outside of the classroom was perfect. The use of the class discussion boards were also really useful -- it got a conversation started before our brief in-class time.
Discussion in person
I loved the online discussions that prepped you for discussion in class.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I think this class should have multiple smaller discussion sections, because the single discussion section had too many people for us to really get into deep conversation. Also, too many topics were covered each day in the discussion sections -- we would just be getting to an interesting conversation, and have to switch topics. We never had enough time to cover all 3 topics scheduled for each session. It might be useful to organize reading groups that meet once a week outside of class (in addition to a broader discussion section).
skill development

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Very effective. I think the in-class discussion time needs to be little longer than what it is now.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I was doing forest conservation with applications of Buddhist concepts, thus, taking this class gave me a bigger picture of how other religious traditions are approaching ecological issues with their own perspectives.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To eliminate religious illiteracy from an ecological lens.

I took this course because I'm very interested in John and Mary Evelyn's work. Also, I think that one course each semester should be "good for your soul" -- asking questions that are broader than pure academic focus.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes, well above expectations
It exceeded my expectations.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Weekly group discussions were great, very stimulating and thought provoking.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: This is a great course for everybody, despite what background you are from
Take it!
Make sure to save enough time to engage with all of the reading and videos.
Take it!
This was one of my favorite courses at FES. It brings together two schools of thought in such a compelling and fruitful manner. Definitely worth taking.
